title: Please help me identify this
content:
I have been trying to find this font, but couldn't find it.

To me it looks like a "Times" variant, but then I noticed the serifs of the capital italicized letters 'I' and 'A' (see detail)

Closest I came to it was 'Times BQ' or in my library it is also listed under "Times New Roman\* MONOTYPE Regular" ...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701121434im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2_4565.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701121434im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1-3_5938.gif)

any help appreciated, the scan is from jd salinger's nine stories (1991 edition)

(already tried identifont, whatthefont)

Font: 

 CG Times 

Solved By: 

 [bowfinpw](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701121434/http:/typophile.com/user/2088 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [2.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701121434/http:/typophile.com/files/2_17.gif) | 8.94 KB |
author: ABCsebastian

comments.content:
Did you try using the [Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701121434/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsearch.php)? When I use it this is definitely Times, and I think the Compugraphic (CG) version that came from Agfa (now Fonts.com) looks like the right one. I think the serifs on your I and A were slightly misprinted, and not actually like the way they appear.

- Mike Yanega

Hey Mike..  
I think you are right about the misprinting,  
CG version seem to be the one !  
I'll mark this as solved, thank you , sebastian
